abstracts.cdata!:
The Transport Sector Project for
            Macedonia had the following ratings: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The lessons
            learned indicate that institutional changes were important
            in this project. Initially, in the FYR of Macedonia, there
            was a gap in understanding of the concept and content of
            railway restructuring between the Client and the Bank staff
            and its consultants. In post command economy countries it is
            difficult for Government entities to accept and put into use
            the idea of freedom to manage. A review of major investment
            decision (the railway IT) during the project led to its
            elimination and project restructuring. Reviewing,
            integrating and processing the several consultants'
            work into an appropriate intervention is time-consuming but
            important work.

5086043.trustfund:
TF039679-CENTRAL ASIA - PROJECTS IN ECA.
            SUPPORT TO ECA TRANSPORT TEAM,TF035648-MACEDONIA, FYR - TRANSPORT PROJECT
5086043.majtheme: Rural development,Financial and private sector development,Public sector governance

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Transport Sector Project is to improve the efficiency of the
            road and railway systems in Macedonia. The main components
            of the project include: 1) the improvement of the
            Tetovo-Grupcin road to lower transportation costs; 2) the
            maintenance of the arterial and regional roads; 3) the
            design and supervision of the pilot maintenance program; 4)
            the supply of equipment for the Fund for National and
            Regional Roads (FNRR); 5) the provision of technical
            assistance and training for FNRR; the supply of equipment
            for the Macedonia Railways (MR); and, 6) the provision of
            technical assistance and training for MR. The project will
            support the restructuring of MR's organization and
            improve its financial viability. Likewise, road management
            improvement will be supported through the provision of
            information management systems, low-cost maintenance
            technologies, and planning tools, as well as technical
            assistance and training to FNRR. Key policies and
            institutional reforms will be supported through the
            implementation of an Action Plan aimed at restoring long
            term viability of MR, and, the formulation of investment and
            maintenance programs to FNRR.
